scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ri, chlo, in, di, ing, pinned, lot, rine, di, ra, to, cu, tor, rats, rate, nige, a, fails, an, cat

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — A person from Nigeria or of [masked] descent.
B. (2 syllables) — A single atom of this element.
C. (2 syllables) — To apply selectivity and taste to, as a collection of fashion items or web pages.
D. (4 syllables) — heater consisting of a series of pipes for circulating steam or hot water to heat rooms or buildings
E. (4 syllables) — to state or express briefly
F. (1 syllables) — to hold fast or prevent from moving
G. (1 syllables) — give away information about somebody
H. (2 syllables) — a game in which numbered balls are drawn at random and players cover the corresponding numbers on their cards
I. (1 syllables) — get worse

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — SYN: horn
B. (1 syllables) — someone (physician or clergyman) who substitutes temporarily for another member of the same profession
C. (2 syllables) — SYN: adapt
D. (2 syllables) — SYN: brim over
E. (1 syllables) — SYN: amercement
F. (2 syllables) — SYN: hatmaker
G. (2 syllables) — A change ringing method on an odd number of bells.
H. (5 syllables) — SYN: one-sidedly
I. (2 syllables) — SYN: exchange
J. (2 syllables) — SYN: traitorous

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
squirm, in, col, pol, ly, hos, fi, suer, de, ac, ing, cent, pitable, state, or, miles, ish, in, lasts, lps, clud, seals, brob, ed

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — an outward or token appearance or form that is deliberately misleading
B. (3 syllables) — Generally unacceptable for public broadcasting but not legally obscene.
C. (1 syllables) — a unit of length used in navigation; exactly 1,852 meters; historically based on the distance spanned by one minute of arc in latitude
D. (2 syllables) — disposed to treat guests and strangers with cordiality and generosity
E. (1 syllables) — a finishing coat applied to exclude moisture
F. (3 syllables) — That makes shiny or smooth.
G. (3 syllables) — allow participation in or the right to be part of; permit to exercise the rights, functions, and responsibilities of
H. (3 syllables) — a cell from which connective tissue develops
I. (2 syllables) — In a stately manner.
J. (1 syllables) — an electric current that reverses direction sinusoidally
K. (1 syllables) — a long-playing phonograph record; designed to be played at 33.3 rpm

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
